intro: Erigeron senilis, commonly known as grayhead fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its grayish-green foliage and daisy-like flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. Erigeron senilis is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
